Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_room_type

The function AIL_set_3D_room_type sets the room type that the listener is currently in.

void AIL_set_3D_room_type(
  HPROVIDER provider,
  S32 room_type
);

In Parameters

provider
indicates the provider to set.
room_type
indicates the one of the MILES_ROOM_TYPE constants.

Discussion

Use ENVIRONMENT_GENERIC to use the provider's default settings. Use AIL_set_3D_sample_effects_level to set control the amount of room effects applied to each sample.

Not all providers change the audio based on the room type. Currently only EAX, EAX 2, and A3D 2 support room types. On EAX providers, the room type is passed directly to EAX. On A3D 2, Miles builds geometry on the fly to match the reverb properties of the EAX room (as you can imagine, this works well for some room types and not so well for others).

You must use the AIL_set_3D_sample_effects_level on most samples when using the Fast 2D or Dolby providers, or your CPU-usage will be extremely high. On the Miles 2D providers, each sample with room effects costs about 7% on a P5/200 (3% on a Pentium II).

You can find out if the provider you are using supports room types by querying the current room type with AIL_3D_room_type if it returns a -1, then room type are unsupported.

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C

Related FAQs: How do I set an EAX reverb room style?
